xxl.io
Class StringConverter

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--xxl.io.Converter
        |
        +--xxl.io.StringConverter
public class StringConverter
extends Converter

This class provides a converter that is able to read and write String objects. In addition to the read and write methods that read or write String objects (these methods get Objects and cast them to String objects) this class contains readUTF and writeUTF methods that gets directly String objects.

Example usage (1). 

     // catch IOExceptions

     try {

         // create a byte array output stream

         ByteArrayOutputStream output = new ByteArrayOutputStream();

         // write two strings to the output stream

         StringConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.write(new DataOutputStream(output), "Hello world!");
         StringConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.write(new DataOutputStream(output), "That's all, folks!");

         // create a byte array input stream on the output stream

         ByteArrayInputStream input = new ByteArrayInputStream(output.toByteArray());

         // read two strings from the input stream

         String s1 = (String)StringConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.read(new DataInputStream(input));
         String s2 = (String)StringConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.read(new DataInputStream(input));

         // print the value and the object

         System.out.println(s1);
         System.out.println(s2);

         // close the streams after use

         input.close();
         output.close();
     }
     catch (IOException ioe) {
         System.out.println("An I/O error occured.");
     }

See Also:
DataInput, DataOutput, IOException

Field Detail

DEFAULT_INSTANCE

public static final StringConverter DEFAULT_INSTANCE
This instance can be used for getting a default instance of StringConverter. It is similar to the Singleton Design Pattern (for further details see Creational Patterns, Prototype in Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software by Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, and John Vlissides) except that there are no mechanisms to avoid the creation of other instances of StringConverter.
Constructor Detail

StringConverter

public StringConverter()
Sole constructor. (For invocation by subclass constructors, typically implicit.)
Method Detail

read

public Object read(DataInput dataInput,
                   Object object)
            throws IOException
Reads in a string that has been encoded using a modified UTF-8 format and returns the restored (String) object.
This implementation ignores the specified object and returns a new String object by calling the readUTF method of the specified data input. So it does not matter when the specified object is null.
Overrides:
read in class Converter
Parameters:
dataInput - the stream to read a modified UTF-8 representation of a string from in order to return a String object.
object - the (String) object to be restored. In this implementation it is ignored.
Returns:
the read String object.
Throws:
IOException - if I/O errors occur.

readUTF

public String readUTF(DataInput dataInput)
               throws IOException
Reads in a string that has been encoded using a modified UTF-8 format and returns the restored (String) object.
This implementation ignores the specified object and returns a new String object by calling the read method and casting its result to String. So it does not matter when the specified object is null.
Parameters:
dataInput - the stream to read a modified UTF-8 representation of a string from in order to return a String object.
Returns:
the read String object.
Throws:
IOException - if I/O errors occur.

write

public void write(DataOutput dataOutput,
                  Object object)
           throws IOException
Writes the specified String object to the specified data output using a modified UTF-8 format.
This implementation uses the writeUTF method of the specified data output in order to write the specified object.
Overrides:
write in class Converter
Parameters:
dataOutput - the stream to write the modified UTF-8 representation of the specified String object to.
object - the String object that modified UTF-8 representation should be written to the data output.
Throws:
IOException - includes any I/O exceptions that may occur.

writeUTF

public void writeUTF(DataOutput dataOutput,
                     String s)
              throws IOException
Writes the specified String object to the specified data output using a modified UTF-8 format.
This implementation uses the write method output in order to write the specified object.
Parameters:
dataOutput - the stream to write the modified UTF-8 representation of the specified String object to.
s - the String object that modified UTF-8 representation should be written to the data output.
Throws:
IOException - includes any I/O exceptions that may occur.

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples how to use a StringConverter. It can also be used to test the functionality of a StringConverter.
Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
